glsa.title: Apache mod_tcl: Format string vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A format string vulnerabilty has been found in Apache mod_tcl, which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Apache mod_tcl is a TCL interpreting module for the Apache 2.x web server.

description.p: Sparfell discovered format string errors in calls to the set_var function in tcl_cmds.c and tcl_core.c.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit the vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the Apache server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All mod_tcl users should upgrade to the latest version:
